translated: Sutra of the Names of Five Thousand and Five Hundred Buddhas, Scroll 5
Translated by Tripiá¹­aka Master JÃ±Änagupta of Northern India during the Great Sui Dynasty
Budha nirÄhaá¹ƒ, amÄnuá¹£a nirÄhaá¹ƒ
In the TathÄgata's stÅ«pa, many lamps should be lit, and excellent incense should be burned.
Among those excellent incenses, many kinds are produced, with the finest five hundred excellent agarwood pieces,
half a ten-part excellent frankincense, and half a ten-part tumeric incense.
Also use three liang of storax, and the same amount of devil's claw leaf incense,
the best alfalfa incense is the same as above, and betel nut and orange peel are three parts each.
The proportions should be complete like this: four parts of turmeric, take one part,ğŸ”½ten parts of stone skin incense should be complete, and two parts of saffron incense,
also two parts of storax, and the same amount of blue lotus and sandalwood.
Thus, the incense is dried in the sun, and when dry, it is finely ground,
Then, taking good, true, excellent honey, it is mixed with the various fragrances.
There are two kinds of true honey, which are used separately to mix with the superior incense,
If there is genuine sesame oil, this oil is used to apply to both hands,
Then, using the oiled hands, the incense is kneaded, and when kneaded well, it is placed in a stone vessel,
When the incense is mixed in this way, it is used to burn in the TathÄgata's stÅ«pa.
It should cause the Buddha's mind to greatly rejoice, and arouse compassion for all beings,
Such the most wonderful various fragrances, various wonderful sounds, and wonderful flowers, etc.
Wearing incense and oil, one burns the supreme lamp, and should recite these dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s,
If one wishes to rely on the teachings of those buddhas, one should follow as previously explained.
Whatever wishes they have will all be accomplished, and they will be able to accomplish them in a short time.
DhÄraá¹‡Ä« wisdom will not be difficult, and all ghosts and spirits will follow their minds.
Yaká¹£as, kumbhÄá¹‡á¸as, and dragon multitudes will also follow their intentions.
If there are hungry ghosts and piÅ›Äcas who have lost their wealth, they should all inform them.
They should come and go frequently to inform them, and whatever they do will be accomplished.
The secret words of ghosts and spirits, devas, and yaká¹£as,
The multitudes of dragons and kumbhÄá¹‡á¸as will proclaim the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« verses for them.
Due to the power of meritorious virtue and diligence, all matters will be accomplished.
Whatever wishes are in the mind will also be accomplished with ease.
In the mind, one should think of the dhÄraá¹‡Ä«. Having recited this dhÄraá¹‡Ä«,
If one wishes to enter the royal palace, one should recite this divine mantra in one's mind.
One will obtain the royal position one wishes for, with many thousands of sentient beings,
The royal family and retinue will all have pure faith, and the ministers and people of the country will also have faith and respect.
They will make many offerings to the Sugatas, and there will be many thousands of boundless sentient beings.
They will follow the actions of that king, and will always be in harmony with their friends.
Whatever they undertake will be quickly accomplished, and they will never see any evil.
If there are sentient beings with deluded and turbid minds, who do not praise him from afar,
They will see that they have no majestic radiance, and are not worthy of that person's great authority and virtue.
If they lose a treasure trove, it will not be difficult to obtain it again; if they lose wealth, it will also be easy to obtain it again.
If they lose words, they will also easily obtain them again; if they lose doors, they will also easily obtain them again.
Various books and thousands of sounds, skilled crafts are not difficult to obtain without hearing,
Able to be a guide for sentient beings, able to subdue enemies and foes.
At the time of seeking unsurpassed enlightenment, the mind is not confused by the fear of death,
All groups of women are pitied, difficult to obtain wealth and treasures are all easily obtained.
The wisdom of all literary meanings skillfully emerges, many hundreds of sentient beings are able to be doctors,
In all places of birth, the eyes are not damaged, and the wisdom of gazing is all unsurpassed.
Desired clothing follows their desires, desired food and drink follow their use,
If one obtains the favor of the rich, all accomplishments are the merits of the mantra.
Upholding dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s without fatigue, when expounding the Dharma one is also not tired,
Expounding various sÅ«tras and establishing them, that wisdom is also without the time of fatigue,
Seeing those who are suitable vessels without jealousy, one teaches them immediately upon seeing those who are suitable to receive the teachings.
If one loves clothing and is arrogant, one lacks the wisdom of dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s,
Or if one is attached to friends' homes, one gives rise to attachment to various robes and alms bowls,
